description: This notification signifies that an EAP session was started on the
host from which this notification has been sent.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpEAPSessionStart OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyDeviceIdentifierType i 1 OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyDeviceIdentifier s EXAMPLE OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyEAPAccessPortEntityIdentifier s EXAMPLE OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyEAPUserIdentifier s EXAMPLE OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyEAPUserGroupIdentifier s EXAMPLE OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyEAPUserRoles s EXAMPLE OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyEAPSignalSequenceNumber u 9999 OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyEAPAccessPortEntityOpenFlag i 1

description: This indicates the type of the device identifier that will be sent
in the serverNotifyDeviceIdentifier attribute. This attribute is sent with
the notification.
variables.name: OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyDeviceIdentifierType

description: A string that can be used to uniquely identify the device which is
acting as an EAP access point. This attribute is sent with the
notification.
variables.name: OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyDeviceIdentifier

description: A string that can be used to identify the interface on the EAP
access point on which the EAP session was started/ended. The format for
this attribute is device specific. For Passport 8600 devices, it will take
the form of ?<slot>/<port>? e.g. ?3/16?. This attribute is sent with the
notification.
variables.name: OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyEAPAccessPortEntityIdentifier

description: The name of the user initiating the EAP session e.g. ?Joe?. This
attribute is sent with the notification.
variables.name: OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyEAPUserIdentifier

description: The groups the user initiating the EAP session is associated with.
The value for this attribute is made available through vendor specific
attributes in the RADIUS authentication message received by the EAP access
point. This attribute may contain multiple group names following the format
?<groupname1>+<groupname2>? e.g. ?Engg+Admin?. This attribute is sent with
the notification.
variables.name: OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyEAPUserGroupIdentifier

description: The name of the role combination. A role combination is a set of
unordered roles; a role being an abstraction used to bind policies with
actual interfaces on devices. Each role takes the form of a string. The
value for this attribute is made available through vendor specific
attributes in the RADIUS authentication message received by the EAP access
point. This attribute may contain multiple roles, in the form
?<role1>+<role2>? e.g. ?Student+TeachingAssistant?. The invalid characters
for a role are : ?+?, ? ? (space), null, lf, cr, bell, bs, HT (tab), VT, FF
(form feed). The maximum length for a role is 31 characters. This attribute
is sent with the notification.
variables.name: OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyEAPUserRoles

description: This is a unique sequence identifier for a EAP session start or
end event. The EAP user session event signaling is done using SNMPv3 Inform
messages. Each time the EAP access point does not get an acknowledgement
for the Inform, it may retry sending the Inform message with the same EAP
signal sequence number so that the Inform receiver can handle duplicate
Informs. This attribute is sent with the notification.
variables.name: OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyEAPSignalSequenceNumber

description: This is a flag indicating whether the receiver of the notification
should perform an ?open? or ?activation? operation on the EAP access port
entity after it has downloaded User based policies for the current EAP user
session. This may be useful for reporting purposes. This attribute is sent
with the notification.
variables.name: OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyEAPAccessPortEntityOpenFlag

description: This notification signifies that an EAP session has ended on the
host from which this notification has been sent.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpEAPSessionEnd OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyDeviceIdentifierType i 1 OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyDeviceIdentifier s EXAMPLE OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyEAPAccessPortEntityIdentifier s EXAMPLE OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyEAPUserIdentifier s EXAMPLE OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyEAPSessionEndReason i 1 OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyEAPSignalSequenceNumber u 9999 OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyEAPSessionStartSignalSequenceNumber u 9999

description: This indicates the type of the device identifier that will be sent
in the serverNotifyDeviceIdentifier attribute. This attribute is sent with
the notification.
variables.name: OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyDeviceIdentifierType

description: A string that can be used to uniquely identify the device which is
acting as an EAP access point. This attribute is sent with the
notification.
variables.name: OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyDeviceIdentifier

description: A string that can be used to identify the interface on the EAP
access point on which the EAP session was started/ended. The format for
this attribute is device specific. For Passport 8600 devices, it will take
the form of ?<slot>/<port>? e.g. ?3/16?. This attribute is sent with the
notification.
variables.name: OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyEAPAccessPortEntityIdentifier

description: The name of the user initiating the EAP session e.g. ?Joe?. This
attribute is sent with the notification.
variables.name: OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyEAPUserIdentifier

description: The reason for the EAP user session end event. This is used for
reporting purposes only. This attribute is sent with the notification.
variables.name: OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyEAPSessionEndReason

description: This is a unique sequence identifier for a EAP session start or
end event. The EAP user session event signaling is done using SNMPv3 Inform
messages. Each time the EAP access point does not get an acknowledgement
for the Inform, it may retry sending the Inform message with the same EAP
signal sequence number so that the Inform receiver can handle duplicate
Informs. This attribute is sent with the notification.
variables.name: OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyEAPSignalSequenceNumber

description: This is the sequence identifier that was associated with the SNMP
Inform message sent for a EAP session started event. It can be used to
correlate the EAP session end event with the notification for the EAP
session start event. This attribute is sent with the notification.
variables.name: OPSUBP-DEVICE-SIGNALING-MIB::ubpNotifyEAPSessionStartSignalSequenceNumber
